title: At-home GPU crypto mining is surging in China — for now
label: Feature
intro:
Quick Take

  • The Block recently looked into the sales and retailer reviews for customized GPU mining cases sold by merchants on the e-commerce platform Taobao.
  • It appears a growing number of Chinese users are buying the idea of mining at home with GPUs in recent months after China’s crackdown over industrial facilities.
  • But they could face serious headwinds as Chinese government toughens up its measures.
excerpt: After China’s crypto mining crackdown this summer, it appears that at-home mining with GPUs has made a comeback over the past several months.

  • But they could face serious headwinds as Chinese government toughens up its measures.

title: Former OpenSea exec's NFT trading did not break the law, but it could provoke regulators
label: Analysis
intro:
Quick Take

  • OpenSea says it is implementing new procedures after a now-former executive was caught trading NFTs with inside knowledge. 
  • While legal sources say the actions didn’t break the law, it could draw the ire of regulators who are already applying heavy scrutiny to the industry. 
  • On Thursday, OpenSea said that Nate Chastain, former head of product, had been asked to resign.
excerpt: Recently revealed trading NFT activity by Opensea head of product Nate Chastain wasn't illegal, but it could still have consequences.
body:
Quick Take

  • OpenSea says it is implementing new procedures after a now-former executive was caught trading NFTs with inside knowledge. 
  • While legal sources say the actions didn’t break the law, it could draw the ire of regulators who are already applying heavy scrutiny to the industry. 
  • On Thursday, OpenSea said that Nate Chastain, former head of product, had been asked to resign.

title: A billion-dollar dispute over a trove of Silk Road bitcoins could reveal identity of 'Individual X'
label: Feature
thumbnailCredit: The Block
intro:
Quick Take

  • Last November, the U.S. government seized a trove of bitcoin said to be connected to the now-defunct dark web marketplace Silk Road.
  • The Department of Justice detailed the activities of someone identified only as “Individual X” who, in the government’s telling, stole the BTC from Silk Road between 2012 and 2013.
  • An entrepreneur is laying claim to the bitcoin, saying an accused Las Vegas fraudster was in control of it when a court compelled him to turn over his assets to the entrepreneur after a court ruling. 
  • The court case creates narratives surrounding the identity of Individual X, which the government claims are false, but the ongoing legal battle could yield more clues to the mystery person’s true identity.
excerpt: The case makes claims about the possible identity of the hacker, which the government says are false, but the legal battle could yield more clues.
body:
Quick Take

  • Last November, the U.S. government seized a trove of bitcoin said to be connected to the now-defunct dark web marketplace Silk Road.
  • The Department of Justice detailed the activities of someone identified only as “Individual X” who, in the government’s telling, stole the BTC from Silk Road between 2012 and 2013.
  • An entrepreneur is laying claim to the bitcoin, saying an accused Las Vegas fraudster was in control of it when a court compelled him to turn over his assets to the entrepreneur after a court ruling. 
  • The court case creates narratives surrounding the identity of Individual X, which the government claims are false, but the ongoing legal battle could yield more clues to the mystery person’s true identity.

  • An entrepreneur is laying claim to the bitcoin, saying an accused Las Vegas fraudster was in control of it when a court compelled him to turn over his assets to the entrepreneur after a court ruling. 
  • The court case creates narratives surrounding the identity of Individual X, which the government claims are false, but the ongoing legal battle could yield more clues to the mystery person’s true identity.

label: Feature
intro:
Quick Take

  • Etherpoems is a new non-fungible token (NFT) collective that is minting poems and putting them directly on-chain.

  • Despite Etherpoems’ novelty, the collective has struggled to generate the same level of activity as other NFT projects that have recently taken the cryptoverse by storm.

  • But it comes at a cost: transaction fees are even more complicated to understand.

title: Institutional clients are pushing NYDIG and Fidelity to offer more ETH services
label: Feature
intro:
Quick Take

  • Ether (ETH) demand among institutions is surging.
  • That’s pushing firms like NYDIG and Fidelity to expand their services for the crypto.
  • Sources say Fidelity’s clients are increasingly asking for ETH support, while NYDIG has already been offering custody for select clients.
excerpt: Coinbase's second-quarter results showed ether (ETH) volumes surpassed bitcoin's for the first time. The backstory: institutional demand for Ethereum's native asset is growing.
body:
Quick Take

  • Ether (ETH) demand among institutions is surging.
  • That’s pushing firms like NYDIG and Fidelity to expand their services for the crypto.
  • Sources say Fidelity’s clients are increasingly asking for ETH support, while NYDIG has already been offering custody for select clients.
